Title: Tonkin Cruise
Description:
Traveling from south to North escaping the heat and rain that followed us from HCMC through our adventures to HoiAn and Hue, we were finally in Hanoi. The weather was amazing and my friend and I took no chances with making certain the weather would be perfect.
We booked with Tonkin Cruise because the one day on Halong Bay was all around the best on all our shopping points: first the earliest start and arrival to board the ship of the 1 day cruises we considered. Local pick up at your hotel/hostel in old quarter of Hanoi made it easy to start our day at 7:00 am. We picked up a group of just under 20 people (2 being children under 10). This was accomplished in 40 minutes! By 8:00 am we were leaving Hanoi and made a rest stop for 10 minutes before arriving at Tonkin Harbor to board our ship by 10:40 am, ahead of schedule.

The ship is well maintained, clean and even luxurious for a one day cruise. Beautifully set tables for dining, a dozen lounge chairs to sun on and relax and enough seating all around the outdoor deck areas. There are shaded areas and the main deck entry conversation corners to also make and get to know new friends.

The toilets are all fully functioning, immaculately kept and all around the Tonkin is a lovely ship. Staff are friendly, Captain always has his doors open today hello and food is delicious and varied. Special dietary needs and allergies were also a concern if the staff in initial booking and again on day of cruise.
The route through the limestone hills and islands allowed for a good survey of the Bay and itâ€™s most beautiful views.

We had ample down time between the many events planned: Kayaking, swimming or lounging in hammocks began our daysâ€™ events. Land transfer and a cave tour was a break from the ship, landing on Cat Ba Island. A spring roll making class followed as we also enjoyed fresh fruits and tea on our way back to Tonkin Harbor for sunset.

WiFi access is a availableâ€”so says the tour informational Booklet, but we were never told of this by our guide.

Our English speaking guide managed to keep us all on schedule and afforded us the promised FULL DAY on the water we wanted from 11am until sunset.

The cruise was US$70/person and booked the night before. All went according to plan promised us.

Beer and other soft drinks are available for a reasonable price onboard. Water was provided on bus to boat and lemon tea while on the boat.

Bus has AC and is clean and comfortable.

All-in-all, an excellent cruise, well managed and guide â€œHungâ€ is so pleasant and funny.
Great value for a full day!

Title: Hoi An Eco Palm River Tour - Day Tours
Description:
Simply had a great day. We hired bikes from where we were staying in Hoi An (Thao Hieu Homestay) and rode down to Cam Thanh Village, taking our time and exploring the local surroundings.
On arrival we had lunch and a couple of rehydrating 333's. The Banh Xeo (rice pancake with pork and shrimp) sounded delicious but in the end I opted for the open faced wantons which were also excellent.
